
Link: https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/cly48nmmzdro?at_medium=RSS&at_campaign=rss
Info: BBC News Article (cly48nmmzdro)
================================================================================
Q1. Who is the leader of the gang that is smuggling people across the English Channel?
A. Jabal
B. Aram
C. al-Millah
D. Besha
Correct Answer: C. al-Millah

Q2. What is the name of the forest hideout where the gang is based?
A. Dunkirk
B. Calais
C. Birmingham
D. Manchester
Correct Answer: A. Dunkirk

Q3. How does the gang receive payment for their services?
A. Cash
B. Bank transfers
C. Intermediaries
D. All of the above
Correct Answer: D. All of the above

Q1. According to the report, what was the cause of the Titan's implosion?
A. Lack of maintenance and inspection protocols
B. Weather conditions
C. Human error
D. Technical failure
Correct Answer: A

Q2. What did the chairman of the Coast Guard Marine Board of Investigation say about the Titan disaster?
A. It was an accident that could have been prevented
B. The company that owned and operated the Titan followed all safety protocols
C. The hull of the Titan was weaker than expected and failed under stress
D. The investigation is ongoing and more information will be released soon
Correct Answer: A

Q3. What was the role of Stockton Rush in the Titan disaster?
A. He was the lead engineer and safety officer
B. He was the pilot of the Titan sub during its fatal voyage
C. He was the founder of OceanGate
D. He was the captain of the Titan sub
Correct Answer: B

Q1. What is the College of Policing guidance on media relations for suspects who have been arrested but not yet charged?
A. Police should only give the suspect's gender and age.
B. Police should give the suspect's occupation if it is relevant to the crime.
C. Police should give the suspect's nationality, asylum status, or ethnicity.
D. None of the above.
Correct Answer: A.

Q2. What does the College of Policing guidance on media relations say about sharing ethnicity or immigration status of someone who has been charged?
A. Police should share ethnicity or immigration status.
B. Police should not share ethnicity or immigration status.
C. The guidance does not make suggestions about ethnicity or immigration status.
D. None of the above.
Correct Answer: C.

Q3. When a car ploughed into crowds celebrating Liverpool FC's winning of the Premiership title, what information did Merseyside Police release about the suspect?
A. The suspect's ethnicity.
B. The suspect's nationality.
C. The suspect's asylum status.
D. The suspect's occupation.
Correct Answer: A.

D. 40%

D. All of the above

A. 1 month
B. 2 months
C. 3 months
D. 4 months
Correct Answer: B

Q1. What is the goal of the redistricting process?
A. To create oddly shaped constituencies that stretch for miles to include, or exclude, voters based on their political affiliations
B. To remove political considerations from the redistricting process
C. To determine the balance of power in the US Congress
D. To set the legislative agenda for the next two years
Correct Answer: A

Q2. What is the power of the party that controls the lower chamber of Congress?
A. To launch sweeping investigations of presidential actions
B. To set the legislative agenda for the next two years
C. To determine the balance of power in the US Congress
D. To remove political considerations from the redistricting process
Correct Answer: A

Q3. What is the recent trend of narrowly decided political battles?
A. Narrowly decided political battles have become more common in recent years
B. Narrowly decided political battles have become less common in recent years
C. Narrowly decided political battles have had no impact on the recent trend of political battles
D. Narrowly decided political battles have had a significant impact on the recent trend of political battles
Correct Answer: D

A. Little Boy
B. Fat Man
C. Atomic Bomb
D. Nuclear Bomb
Correct Answer: A

A. It caused a fire that burned for 4 days
B. It killed some 70,000 people instantly
C. It caused a tsunami that killed thousands of people
D. It caused a tornado that destroyed the city
Correct Answer: B

A. They were not affected by the bomb
B. They were not citizens of Korea
C. They were not alive during the bombing
D. They were not considered important enough to be acknowledged
Correct Answer: D

Info: News Article
================================================================================
Q1. What is the purpose of the Trump administration's proposal regarding drones?
A. To make it easier for companies to use drones for business
B. To speed up the use of unmanned aerial vehicles by businesses in the U.S.
C. To place an artificial ceiling on innovation and hamper progress
D. To ensure that emerging technologies and drone operations do not compromise aviation safety
Correct Answer: A

Q2. What is the main concern of Lisa Ellman, CEO of the Commercial Drone Alliance about the proposed drone rule?
A. That drones used by businesses would have to be built to certain industry standards and have collision avoidance technology
B. That commercial drones would be banned from flying over large outdoor gatherings
C. That certain employees would be subject to a security check by the Transportation Security Administration
D. That drone operators must navigate a labyrinth of ill-suited regulations designed for crude aircraft
Correct Answer: D

Q3. What is the main concern of the Air Line Pilots Association about the proposed drone rule?
A. That drones used by businesses would have to be built to certain industry standards and have collision avoidance technology
B. That commercial drones would be banned from flying over large outdoor gatherings
C. That certain employees would be subject to a security check by the Transportation Security Administration
D. That recent tragic events have underscored the critical importance of maintaining rigorous safety standards in our increasingly complex airspace
Correct Answer: D

Q1. What is the Overdose Data to Action or OD2A program?
A. A program that helps lower overdose deaths from fentanyl, methamphetamines and other drugs across the U.S.
B. A program that helps lower overdose deaths from tobacco use, nutrition, physical activity and obesity, school health, inflammatory bowel disease, excessive alcohol use, chronic disease education and awareness, national diabetes prevention program, oral health, epilepsy, and more.
C. A program that helps lower overdose deaths from youth violence prevention, adverse childhood experiences, firearm injury, injury control research centers, and injury prevention activities.
D. A program that helps lower overdose deaths from rape prevention and education.
Correct Answer: A

Q2. What is the National Diabetes Prevention Program?
A. A program that helps lower overdose deaths from fentanyl, methamphetamines and other drugs across the U.S.
B. A program that helps lower overdose deaths from tobacco use, nutrition, physical activity and obesity, school health, inflammatory bowel disease, excessive alcohol use, chronic disease education and awareness, national diabetes prevention program, oral health, epilepsy, and more.
C. A program that helps lower overdose deaths from youth violence prevention, adverse childhood experiences, firearm injury, injury control research centers, and injury prevention activities.
D. A program that helps lower overdose deaths from rape prevention and education.
Correct Answer: B

Q3. What is the Injury Center at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention?
A. A center that helps lower overdose deaths from fentanyl, methamphetamines and other drugs across the U.S.
B. A center that helps lower overdose deaths from tobacco use, nutrition, physical activity and obesity, school health, inflammatory bowel disease, excessive alcohol use, chronic disease education and awareness, national diabetes prevention program, oral health, epilepsy, and more.
C. A center that helps lower overdose deaths from youth violence prevention, adverse childhood experiences, firearm injury, injury control research centers, and injury prevention activities.
D. A center

Link: https://www.npr.org/2025/08/05/nx-s1-5482913/social-security-phone-sharing-system
Info: News Article
================================================================================
Q1. What is the new phone sharing system implemented by the Social Security Administration (SSA)?
A. Calls to local field offices are rerouted to available staff at other field offices, regardless of geographic location, to help manage high call volumes.
B. Calls to local field offices are rerouted to staff who don't have jurisdiction over the caller's case.
C. Calls to local field offices are rerouted to staff who have jurisdiction over the caller's case.
D. Calls to local field offices are not rerouted to any other field offices.
Correct Answer: A

Q2. According to Angela Digeronimo, what does the new phone sharing system create for people calling into their local office?
A. A "hit or miss" situation for people calling in to their local office.
B. A situation where it is taking more time to help people get and keep Social Security disability benefits.
C. A situation where workers in other field offices can see what's going on with someone's case but can't "actually take care of the issue."
D. A situation where all SSA field offices are equipped to handle inquiries and resolve issues for callers, irrespective of where a caller lives or where their case originated.
Correct Answer: A

Q3. What is the main concern of Jen Burdick, a supervising attorney at Community Legal Services of Philadelphia, about the new phone sharing system?
A. It is taking her group "more time to help people" get and keep Social Security disability benefits.
B. It is creating a situation where it is taking more time to help people get and keep Social Security disability benefits.
C. It is creating a situation where workers in other field offices can see what's going on with someone's case but can't "actually take care of the issue."
D. It is creating a situation where all SSA field offices are equipped to handle inquiries and resolve issues for callers, irrespective of where a caller lives or where their case originated.
Correct Answer: A

Q1. What was the outcome of the defamation lawsuit by Dominion Voting Systems against Fox News?
A. Fox News was found guilty of defamation.
B. Dominion Voting Systems was found guilty of defamation.
C. The case was settled out of court.
D. The jury trial was held and a verdict was reached.
Correct Answer: C. The case was settled out of court.

Q2. How much money did Fox News pay to settle the defamation lawsuit with Dominion Voting Systems?
A. $787 million
B. $1.6 billion
C. $10 million
D. $50 million
Correct Answer: A. $787 million

Q3. What was the reason for the settlement of the defamation lawsuit between Dominion Voting Systems and Fox News?
A. The jury trial was about to begin.
B. The parties reached a mutual agreement.
C. The judge ordered the settlement.
D. The evidence presented in court showed that Dominion Voting Systems rigged the presidential election.
Correct Answer: B. The parties reached a mutual agreement.

Info: News Article
================================================================================
Q1. What is the current situation with the debt ceiling?
A. The House GOP majority has agreed to lift the cap on government borrowing.
B. The House GOP majority has refused to lift the cap on government borrowing unless President Biden agrees to spending cuts.
C. The US government has defaulted on its obligations.
D. The US government has always had a stellar credit rating.
Correct Answer: B

Q2. What is Speaker Kevin McCarthy's plan to resolve the debt ceiling issue?
A. Raise the debt limit for a year but require a flurry of spending concessions from President Biden.
B. Raise the debt limit for a year without any spending concessions from President Biden.
C. Refuse to raise the debt limit unless President Biden agrees to spending cuts.
D. Default on government obligations.
Correct Answer: A

Q3. What is the current state of negotiations between Speaker Kevin McCarthy and President Joe Biden over the debt ceiling?
A. There are no negotiations taking place.
B. Internal disagreement among GOP members over what should be in the package.
C. The White House has insisted the House should do its job and pass a simple bill that only raises the borrowing limit.
D. The speaker has already set up a severe test of his leadership since there's no guarantee that he can pass the measure in a House where he can only lose four votes.
Correct Answer: B

Info: News Article
================================================================================
Q1. What is the name of the 13-year-old who died after taking part in the Benadryl Challenge on TikTok?
A. Jacob
B. Stevens
C. Johnson
D. Benadryl
Correct Answer: B. Stevens

Q2. What is the warning issued by the US Food and Drug Administration about the Benadryl Challenge on TikTok?
A. Overdosing on Benadryl can result in “serious heart problems, seizures, coma, or even death.”
B. Benadryl is an antihistamine used to treat symptoms such as a runny nose or sneezing from upper respiratory allergies, hay fever or the common cold.
C. The Benadryl Challenge on TikTok is not dangerous.
D. The maker of Benadryl, Johnson & Johnson, has called the challenge “dangerous.”
Correct Answer: A. Overdosing on Benadryl can result in “serious heart problems, seizures, coma, or even death.”

Q3. What is the statement made by the maker of Benadryl, Johnson & Johnson, about the Benadryl Challenge on TikTok?
A. The challenge is not dangerous.
B. The challenge is dangerous.
C. The challenge is not related to Benadryl.
D. The maker of Benadryl, Johnson & Johnson, has not made a statement about the challenge.
Correct Answer: B. The challenge is dangerous.

================================================================================


Link: https://www.cnn.com/2023/04/18/tech/lina-khan-ai-warning/index.html
Info: News Article
================================================================================
Q1. What is the concern of FTC chair Lina Khan about the use of AI tools such as ChatGPT?
A. They could lead to a “turbocharging” of consumer harms including fraud and scams.
B. They could enable algorithmic discrimination and privacy issues.
C. They could promote specific AI rules.
D. They could lead to a revolution in technology.
Correct Answer: A.

Q2. What is the authority of the US government to crack down on AI-driven consumer harms under existing law?
A. Substantial authority.
B. Limited authority.
C. No authority.
D. Unclear authority.
Correct Answer: A.

Q3. What is the obligation of the FTC in applying the tools they have to changing technologies?
A. Not be scared off by the idea that this is a new, revolutionary technology.
B. Promote specific AI rules.
C. Abide by the law.
D. Mislead consumers about the capabilities and limitations of AI tools.
Correct Answer: C.

Q1. Which study was published Monday in the journal Nature Medicine?
A. A study on the effects of exercise on mental health
B. A study on the impact of diet on type 2 diabetes
C. A study on the effects of climate change on global food production
D. A study on the impact of social media on mental health
Correct Answer: B

Q2. According to the study, which three factors were the primary drivers of over 14 million new cases of type 2 diabetes in 2018?
A. Eating too many unhealthy foods and too few wholesome foods
B. Drinking too many sugar-sweetened beverages and fruit juice
C. Not getting enough sleep and exercising too much
D. Consuming too many refined wheat and rice products and too few whole grains
Correct Answer: D

A. Poland and Russia
B. Colombia and Mexico
C. China and India
D. Brazil and Argentina
Correct Answer: A

D. The Federal Drug Administration

Correct Answer: A

A. The Justice Department filed federal criminal charges against Stockton Rush.
B. The Coast Guard recommended that the Justice Department file federal criminal charges against Stockton Rush.
C. The Coast Guard found no evidence of wrongdoing by OceanGate.
D. The Coast Guard found that OceanGate had followed all regulations and guidelines.
Correct Answer: A

Q1. What is the Indian government's policy on energy import sources?

B. The Indian government decides its energy import sources based on the price at which oil is available in the domestic market and depending on the global situation at that time.
C. The Indian government decides its energy import sources based on the price at which oil is available in the international market and depending on the domestic situation at that time.
D. The Indian government decides its energy import sources based on the price at which oil is available in the domestic market and depending on the global situation at that time.
Correct Answer: A

Q2. What is the Indian government's policy on energy imports from Russia?
A. The Indian government has a policy of not importing energy from Russia.
B. The Indian government has a policy of importing energy from Russia based on the price at which oil is available in the international market and depending on the global situation at that time.
C. The Indian government has a policy of importing energy from Russia based on the price at which oil is available in the domestic market and depending on the global situation at that time.
D. The Indian government has a policy of importing energy from Russia based on the price at which oil is available in the domestic market and depending on the global situation at that time.
Correct Answer: B

C. The Indian government has a policy of importing energy from other countries based on the price at which oil is available in the domestic market and depending on the global situation at that time.
D. The Indian government has a policy of importing energy from other countries based on the price at which oil is available in the domestic market and depending on the global situation at that time.
Correct Answer: A

A. 10%
B. 15%
C. 20%
D. 25%
Correct Answer: B. 15%

Q2. What is the tariff rate levied on Thailand?
A. 10%
B. 15%
C. 20%
D. 25%
Correct Answer: B. 15%

Q3. What is the tariff rate levied on Taiwan?
A. 10%
B. 15%
C. 20%
D. 25%
Correct Answer: B. 15%

D. A tornado

C. "Watashi ga Mita"
D. "Mirai"

Q1. What was the ruling of the U.K.'s Court of Appeal in October last year?
A. It was unlawful for car dealers to receive bonuses from banks providing motor finance without getting the customer's informed consent.
B. It was legal for car dealers to receive bonuses from banks providing motor finance without getting the customer's informed consent.
C. It was legal for car dealers to receive bonuses from banks providing motor finance with the customer's informed consent.

A. He believes this is an ideal way for this issue to be handed back to the FCA to set up a softer redress scheme.
B. He believes this is an ideal way for this issue to be handed back to the court to set up a softer redress scheme.
C. He believes this is an ideal way for the government to set up a softer redress scheme.
D. He believes this is an ideal way for the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) to set up a softer redress scheme.
Correct Answer: D

A. It will make decisions on whether to implement a redress scheme or not.
B. It will make decisions on the amount of compensation to be paid to consumers.
C. It will make decisions on the criteria for determining whether a consumer is eligible for compensation.
D. It will make decisions on the timeline for implementing the redress scheme.
Correct Answer: C

A. He is in removal proceedings to be deported and is being held at an immigration detention facility in Arizona
B. He is sleeping in a chair and living off food sold in the airport
C. He is helping to research a vaccine for Lyme disease
D. None of the above
Correct Answer: A

================================================================================
Q1. What is the main goal of the nearly five-year study on Mounjaro?
A. To reduce the risk of cardiovascular death, heart attack or stroke by 8% when compared to Trulicity in adults with Type 2 diabetes and cardiovascular disease.
B. To reduce the risk of cardiovascular death, heart attack or stroke by 10% when compared to Trulicity in adults with Type 2 diabetes and cardiovascular disease.
C. To reduce the risk of cardiovascular death, heart attack or stroke by 5% when compared to Trulicity in adults with Type 2 diabetes and cardiovascular disease.
D. To reduce the risk of cardiovascular death, heart attack or stroke by 7% when compared to Trulicity in adults with Type 2 diabetes and cardiovascular disease.
Correct Answer: A

Q2. What is the difference in the rate of death from any cause between Mounjaro and Trulicity?
A. Mounjaro has a higher rate of death from any cause than Trulicity.
B. Mounjaro has a lower rate of death from any cause than Trulicity.
C. The difference in the rate of death from any cause between Mounjaro and Trulicity is "really quite profound" and "definitely something clinically meaningful to us as clinicians."
D. The difference in the rate of death from any cause between Mounjaro and Trulicity is not significant.
Correct Answer: C

Q3. What is the expected outcome of Eli Lilly submitting the heart health data to global regulators by the end of the year?
A. Approval of Mounjaro for heart health purposes and insurance coverage for patients.
B. Approval of Mounjaro for heart health purposes but no insurance coverage for patients.
C. Approval of Trulicity for heart health purposes and insurance coverage for patients.
D. Approval of Trulicity for heart health purposes but no insurance coverage for patients.
Correct Answer: A

Q1. What is the name of the new study that could lead to the development of a universal shot to fight cancer?
A. Cancer Vaccine Study
B. Universal Immune System Study
C. Immunity Boosting Study
D. Cancer Cell Targeting Study
Correct Answer: B. Universal Immune System Study

Q2. What is the main difference between the new vaccine and current approaches to cancer vaccines?
A. The new vaccine is designed for a specific virus or cancer cells.
B. The new vaccine is engineered to "wake up" the immune system against the disease.
C. The new vaccine involves finding a target expressed by many cancer patients.
D. The new vaccine involves developing personalized vaccines tailored to each patient's specific tumor.

A. PD-L1
B. Interleukin-5
C. Tumor Necrosis Factor-alpha
D. Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV)
Correct Answer: A. PD-L1

B. 1965
C. 1975
D. 1985

================================================================================
Q1. What is the Energy Star Portfolio Manager tool?
A. A system that connects utilities to landlords and then to dozens of state and municipal governments who rely on it to uphold their energy and climate policies, many of which include tax breaks and financial subsidies for energy savings.
B. A system that tracks energy usage in commercial buildings and provides data to landlords to maintain compliance with state and municipal regulations and gauge energy performance of buildings in their portfolios.
C. A system that ingests building data to automate real estate operations and can tap into Energy Star data from the past.
D. A system that provides hundreds of billions of dollars of savings for consumers and businesses in its current form.
Correct Answer: A

Q2. What is the purpose of the Energy Star Portfolio Manager tool?
A. To track energy usage in commercial buildings and provide data to landlords to maintain compliance with state and municipal regulations and gauge energy performance of buildings in their portfolios.
B. To connect utilities to landlords and then to dozens of state and municipal governments who rely on it to uphold their energy and climate policies, many of which include tax breaks and financial subsidies for energy savings.
C. To automate real estate operations and tap into Energy Star data from the past.
D. To provide hundreds of billions of dollars of savings for consumers and businesses in its current form.
Correct Answer: B

Q3. What would happen if the Energy Star Portfolio Manager tool were no longer a government program?
A. The data would disappear with it, and what this means is that the hub, the connected tissue around how utility landlord and state and municipal governments share energy data across them, would all go away.
B. The likely result would be a complicated patchwork of compliance.
C. The system would become a fee-based system that would increase the cost to use this program.
D. The system would continue to provide hundreds of billions of dollars of savings for consumers and businesses in its current form.
Correct Answer: A

================================================================================


Link: https://www.pbs.org/newshour/nation/study-says-chatgpt-giving-teens-dangerous-advice-on-drugs-alcohol-and-suicide
Info: News Article from 
================================================================================
Q1. What is the name of the watchdog group that conducted the research on ChatGPT?
A. OpenAI
B. Common Sense Media
C. Character.AI
D. The AP
Correct Answer: B. Common Sense Media

Q2. What is the percentage of teens in the U.S. who use AI chatbots regularly according to a recent study from Common Sense Media?
A. 50%
B. 70%
C. 90%
D. 80%
Correct Answer: B. 70%

Q3. What is the design feature of AI language models that previous research has described as sycophancy?
A. A tendency for AI responses to challenge, rather than match, a person’s beliefs because the system has learned to say what people want to hear.
B. A tendency for AI responses to match, rather than challenge, a person’s beliefs because the system has learned to say what people want to hear.
C. A tendency for AI responses to be random and unpredictable.
D. A tendency for AI responses to be factual and informative.
Correct Answer: B. A tendency for AI responses to match, rather than challenge, a person’s beliefs because the system has learned to say what people want to hear.

================================================================================


Link: https://www.cnbc.com/2025/08/06/warren-asks-ftc-to-consider-blocking-dicks-foot-locker-merger.html
Info: News Article from 
================================================================================
Q1. What is Elizabeth Warren's concern about the proposed acquisition of Foot Locker by Dick's Sporting Goods?
A. It could reduce competition in the athletic shoe store sector.
B. It could lead to higher prices for athletic footwear.
C. It could create a duopoly in sneakers and other athletic shoes.
D. It could squeeze smaller businesses.
Correct Answer: C. It could create a duopoly in sneakers and other athletic shoes.

Q2. According to Elizabeth Warren, what is the risk of the merger between Dick's Sporting Goods and Foot Locker?
A. It could lead to further economic hardship for parents.
B. It could give Dick's and Foot Locker an incentive to engage in anticompetitive conduct.
C. It could mean that independent retailers are at a disadvantage when it comes to negotiating with suppliers.
D. It could represent around 15% of the sporting goods market.
Correct Answer: B. It could give Dick's and Foot Locker an incentive to engage in anticompetitive conduct.

Q3. What is the Federal Trade Commission's approach to mergers under President Joe Biden?
A. It has taken an aggressive approach to mergers and quashed a number of high-profile planned tie-ups.
B. It has not taken any action on mergers.
C. It is unclear how new leadership at the FTC and Department of Justice will view mergers in the retail industry.
D. It has not been mentioned in the article.
Correct Answer: A. It has taken an aggressive approach to mergers and quashed a number of high-profile planned tie-ups.

C. The last time Trump tried using triple-figure tariffs against China, he found it did not work.
D. The US-EU trade relationship is the biggest in the world.
Correct Answer: A. US imports from China are worth five times as much as those from India.

B. The study found that more than 400 other deaths could be blamed on the event.

D. The study found that there is no connection between wildfire smoke and respiratory health.

C. The study shows that other studies would need to be done to explore cause-and-effect.
D. The study concludes that there is no connection between wildfire smoke and respiratory health.
Correct Answer: B.

Correct Answer: C. It remained the same.

D. Zika

B. They can be given mosquito nets and insecticide to spray residential areas, streets and construction sites.
C. They can be advised to wear long sleeves and pants to avoid mosquito bites.
D. They can be told to avoid traveling to areas with high mosquito populations.

Q1. What is the Trump administration's crackdown on immigration?
A. It is a policy that allows aliens not lawfully present in the United States to get in-state tuition benefits.
B. It is a policy that denies aliens not lawfully present in the United States from getting in-state tuition benefits.
C. It is a policy that requires aliens not lawfully present in the United States to live in Texas for three years before graduating from high school and for a year before enrolling in college to qualify for in-state tuition.
D. It is a policy that allows students without legal resident status to qualify for in-state tuition if they have lived in Texas for three years before graduating from high school and for a year before enrolling in college.

A. It is a policy that allows aliens not lawfully present in the United States to get in-state tuition benefits.
B. It is a policy that denies aliens not lawfully present in the United States from getting in-state tuition benefits.
C. It is a policy that requires aliens not lawfully present in the United States to live in Texas for three years before graduating from high school and for a year before enrolling in college to qualify for in-state tuition.
D. It is a policy that allows students without legal resident status to qualify for in-state tuition if they have lived in Texas for three years before graduating from high school and for a year before enrolling in college.
Correct Answer: B. It is a policy that denies aliens not lawfully present in the United States from getting in-state tuition benefits.

A. It is a policy that allows aliens not lawfully present in the United States to get in-state tuition benefits.

B. To shift iPhone production to India to avoid tariffs
C. To increase investment in the United States
D. To produce components for Apple products sold all over the world
Correct Answer: A. To ensure that iPhones sold in the United States are made in America

B. Pardon Attorney and director of the administration's new "Weaponization Working Group"
C. None of the above
D. Attorney General
Correct Answer: A

Q3. What was the outcome of Jared Wise's trial?
A. He was found guilty of civil disorder, disorderly conduct on Capitol grounds, and aiding and abetting an assault on law enforcement officers
B. He was found guilty of assaulting police officers
C. He was found not guilty of any charges
D. None of the above
Correct Answer: A

Q1. What is the reason behind the NFL's ban on smelling salts?

B. NFL players have been found to use smelling salts more frequently than intended.
C. Smelling salts are not medically indicated for use on the field.
D. The NFL has not released any official statement regarding the ban on smelling salts.
Correct Answer: A

Q2. What is the physiological reaction caused by inhaling smelling salts?
A. It leads to an increase in respiratory rate, cerebral blood flow, and heart rate.
B. It causes a subjective increase in perceived alertness and 'psyched-up energy.'
C. It activates receptors in the nose that lead to a cascade of reactions that cause an increase in respiratory rate, cerebral blood flow, and heart rate.
D. Smelling salts have no physiological reaction when inhaled.
Correct Answer: C

Q3. What are the potential adverse events that can occur from inappropriate and frequent use of smelling salts?
A. Shortness of breath, seizures, and migraines.
B. Increased alertness and energy.
C. No adverse events have been reported from inappropriate and frequent use of smelling salts.
D. Smelling salts are only used for medicinal purposes.
Correct Answer: A

B. Crimea, Donetsk, Luhansk, Zaporizhzhia
C. Crimea, Donetsk, Luhansk, Kherson
D. Crimea, Donetsk, Luhansk, Zaporizhzhia, Kherson
Correct Answer: A

Q2. What does Ukraine agree to in the talks?
A. Recognition of Russian sovereignty over the Ukrainian regions of Crimea, Donetsk, Luhansk, Zaporizhzhia, and Kherson
B. Demilitarization, neutrality, no foreign military involvement, and new elections
C. Recognition of Russian sovereignty over the Ukrainian regions of Crimea, Donetsk, Luhansk, and Zaporizhzhia
D. Recognition of Russian sovereignty over the Ukrainian regions of Crimea, Donetsk, Luhansk, and Kherson, and Ukraine agreeing to demilitarization, neutrality, no foreign military involvement, and new elections
Correct Answer: A

Q3. What is the current status of the war in Ukraine?
A. The war in Ukraine has ended
B. The war in Ukraine is ongoing and shows no sign of abating
C. The war in Ukraine has been resolved through diplomatic means
D. The war in Ukraine has been resolved through military means
Correct Answer: B

Q1. What is the purpose of the 2030 census?
A. To determine how presidents and members of Congress are elected
B. To tally non-U.S. residents
C. To exclude immigrants in the U.S.
D. To ask the question "Is this person a citizen of the United States?"
Correct Answer: A

Q2. What is the Trump administration's renewed focus on?
A. Including the total number of persons residing in the states in census tallies
B. Excluding U.S. residents from the census
C. Using the once-a-decade tally by the federal government to ask the question "Is this person a citizen of the United States?"
D. Using the 2030 census to tally non-U.S. residents
Correct Answer: C

Q3. What is the Supreme Court's finding on the first Trump administration's stated justification for a census citizenship question?
A. It appeared "contrived"
B. It was necessary to better enforce the voting rights of racial minority groups
C. It was necessary to produce faulty self-reported data and discourage many households with Latino or Asian American residents from getting tallied in official population totals
D. It was necessary to exclude immigrants in the U.S.
Correct Answer: A

================================================================================
Q1. What is the White House leader's stance on India's purchase of Russian oil?
A. The White House leader is happy with India's purchase of Russian oil.
B. The White House leader is not happy with India's purchase of Russian oil.
C. The White House leader has no stance on India's purchase of Russian oil.
D. The White House leader's stance on India's purchase of Russian oil is unclear.
Correct Answer: B. The White House leader is not happy with India's purchase of Russian oil.

Q2. What is the Indian Petroleum Minister's stance on buying Russian oil?
A. The Indian Petroleum Minister is happy with buying Russian oil.
B. The Indian Petroleum Minister is not happy with buying Russian oil.
C. The Indian Petroleum Minister has no stance on buying Russian oil.
D. The Indian Petroleum Minister's stance on buying Russian oil is unclear.
Correct Answer: B. The Indian Petroleum Minister is not happy with buying Russian oil.

Q3. What is the International Energy Agency's forecast for India's demand for oil over the next decade?
A. The International Energy Agency forecasts that India will add 1 million barrels per day of demand over the next decade.
B. The International Energy Agency forecasts that India will add 2 million barrels per day of demand over the next decade.
C. The International Energy Agency forecasts that India will add 3 million barrels per day of demand over the next decade.
D. The International Energy Agency forecasts that India will add 4 million barrels per day of demand over the next decade.
Correct Answer: A. The International Energy Agency forecasts that India will add 1 million barrels per day of demand over the next decade.

D. It doesn't allow kids under 13 to chat with other users outside of games.

D. Betelgeuse

D. 40 to 50 degrees Fahrenheit
Correct Answer: A

B. Saturn's hydrocarbon-rich Titan

D. The moon of the planet candidate orbiting Alpha Centauri A

Info: News Article from 
================================================================================
Q1. What was the goal of Dominion Voting Systems in its defamation case against Fox News?
A. Accountability
B. To make Dominion whole
C. To promote lies about the 2020 election
D. To ridicule claims of election fraud
Correct Answer: A

Q2. What was the payment made by Fox News to Dominion and what did it acknowledge?
A. $787 million for promoting lies about the 2020 election
B. $787 million for accountability
C. $787 million for making Dominion whole
D. $787 million for acknowledging that its coverage of the 2020 election was false
Correct Answer: D

Q3. What was the message conveyed by Justin Nelson about the consequences of lying?
A. There are no consequences to lying
B. Lying doesn't matter
C. Eventually there will be consequences to lying
D. Lying is always justified
Correct Answer: C

Info: News Article from 
================================================================================
Q1. What was the outcome of the defamation lawsuit by Dominion Voting Systems against Fox News?
A. Fox News was found guilty of defamation.
B. Dominion Voting Systems was found guilty of defamation.
C. The case was settled out of court.
D. The jury trial was held and a verdict was reached.
Correct Answer: C. The case was settled out of court.

Q2. What was the amount that Fox News paid to settle the defamation lawsuit with Dominion Voting Systems?
A. $787 million
B. $1.6 billion
C. $10 million
D. $50 million
Correct Answer: A. $787 million

Q3. What was the reason given by Judge Eric Davis for the settlement of the defamation lawsuit between Dominion Voting Systems and Fox News?
A. The parties reached a mutually beneficial agreement.
B. The jury trial was about to begin and the parties wanted to avoid a lengthy and costly legal battle.
C. The evidence presented in the case showed that Fox News was telling the truth about Dominion Voting Systems.
D. The evidence presented in the case showed that Dominion Voting Systems was telling the truth about Fox News.
Correct Answer: B. The jury trial was about to begin and the parties wanted to avoid a lengthy and costly legal battle.

Q1. What is the current situation with the debt ceiling in the United States?
A. The House GOP majority has lifted the cap on government borrowing.
B. The House GOP majority has refused to lift the cap on government borrowing unless President Biden agrees to spending cuts.
C. The US government has defaulted on its obligations.
D. The US government has never had a problem paying its bills.
Correct Answer: B

Q2. What is Speaker Kevin McCarthy's plan to resolve the debt ceiling crisis?
A. Raise the debt limit for a year without any spending concessions from President Biden.
B. Raise the debt limit for a year but require a flurry of spending concessions from President Biden.
C. Let the US government default on its obligations.
D. Do nothing about the debt ceiling crisis.
Correct Answer: B

Q3. What is the current state of negotiations between Speaker Kevin McCarthy and President Joe Biden over the debt ceiling?
A. There are no negotiations taking place.
B. Speaker Kevin McCarthy has already set up a severe test of his leadership.
C. The White House has insisted the House should do its job and pass a simple bill that only raises the borrowing limit.
D. There are signs of internal disagreement on what should be in the package among GOP members.
Correct Answer: D

C. They could promote specific AI rules.

A. Substantial authority.
B. Limited authority.
C. No authority.
D. Unclear authority.

B. Promote specific AI rules.
C. Abide by the law.

Q1. What percentage of teens in the United States report abusing prescription stimulants for attention deficit hyperactivity disorder during the year prior?
A. 1 in 10
B. 1 in 20
C. 1 in 40
D. 1 in 80
Correct Answer: D. 1 in 80

A. Northeast
B. South
C. Midwest
D. West
Correct Answer: A. Northeast

Q3. What is the relationship between marijuana use and abuse of ADHD medications among teens?
A. Marijuana use is not related to abuse of ADHD medications.
B. Teens who use marijuana are less likely to abuse ADHD medications.
C. Teens who use marijuana are more likely to abuse ADHD medications.
D. Teens who use marijuana are neutral on the issue of ADHD medications.
Correct Answer: C. Teens who use marijuana are more likely to abuse ADHD medications.

Link: https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/wireStory/texas-dispute-highlights-nations-long-history-partisan-gerrymandering-124352085
Info: News Article from 
================================================================================
Q1. What event prompted the Democratic lawmakers to flee Texas?
A. The Supreme Court ruled against gerrymandering.
B. The Republican-led Legislature passed a law banning voting rights.
C. The state's constitution was amended to protect voting rights.
D. The state's congressional districts were redrawn by the Democratic-led Legislature.
Correct Answer: B. The Republican-led Legislature passed a law banning voting rights.

Q2. What did the Supreme Court write about partisan gerrymandering?
A. It is a violation of the Constitution.
B. It is not possible to determine if a districting map treats a political party fairly.
C. It is a violation of the Voting Rights Act.
D. It is a violation of state constitutions and laws.
Correct Answer: B. It is not possible to determine if a districting map treats a political party fairly.

Q3. What did the Supreme Court say about partisan gerrymandering claims in a 2023 case from Alabama?
A. The congressional districts drawn by the state's Republican-led Legislature likely violated the Voting Rights Act by diluting the voting strength of Black residents.
B. The state's constitution was amended to protect voting rights.
C. The Supreme Court ruled against gerrymandering.
D. The state's constitution was amended to ban voting rights.
Correct Answer: A. The congressional districts drawn by the state's Republican-led Legislature likely violated the Voting Rights Act by diluting the voting strength of Black residents.

A. 35 billion Singapore dollars
B. 39 billion Singapore dollars
C. 40 billion Singapore dollars
D. 45 billion Singapore dollars
Correct Answer: B. 39 billion Singapore dollars

A. 30 billion Singapore dollars
B. 35 billion Singapore dollars
C. 40 billion Singapore dollars
D. 45 billion Singapore dollars
Correct Answer: B. 35 billion Singapore dollars

Q3. What is the Monetary Authority of Singapore's equity market development program (EMDP)?
A. A program to inject $5 billion Singapore dollars into local small- and mid-cap stocks to revitalize market liquidity
B. A program to inject $5 billion Singapore dollars into local large-cap stocks to revitalize market liquidity
C. A program to inject $5 billion Singapore dollars into local stocks to revitalize market liquidity
D. A program to inject $5 billion Singapore dollars into local bonds to revitalize market liquidity
Correct Answer: A. A program to inject $5 billion Singapore dollars into local small- and mid-cap stocks to revitalize market liquidity

D. They are not allowed to retire early with retirement benefits.
Correct Answer: B.

================================================================================
Q1. What is the Air Force's new policy on transgender service members who have served between 15 and 18 years?
A. They will be allowed to retire early with benefits.
B. They will be separated from the service without benefits.
C. They will be allowed to apply for an exception to the policy.
D. They will be given the option to either volunteer to leave or be involuntarily separated at a later date.
Correct Answer: B. They will be separated from the service without benefits.

Q2. How many transgender service members were "prematurely notified" that they would be able to retire before the decision was reversed?
A. None of the exceptions to policy were approved.
B. About a dozen service members were notified.
C. All transgender members of the Air Force are being separated from the service.
D. The move comes after the Pentagon was given permission in early May by the Supreme Court to move forward with a ban on all transgender troops serving in the military.
Correct Answer: B. About a dozen service members were notified.

Q3. What is the Air Force's reason for denying retirement benefits to transgender service members who have served between 15 and 18 years?
A. They were not permitted to apply for an exception to policy.
B. The choice to deny retirement benefits was made after careful consideration of the individual applications.
C. The move comes after the Pentagon was given permission in early May by the Supreme Court to move forward with a ban on all transgender troops serving in the military.
D. The separation process has hit some bumps.
Correct Answer: B. The choice to deny retirement benefits was made after careful consideration of the individual applications.

A. To require the banking industry to ensure it is not refusing financial services to anyone based on political or religious beliefs

C. To levy fines or other disciplinary measures as needed

D. Watching the impact of the tariffs on pricing.
Correct Answer: D

Q2. What is the current law in Nevada regarding emergency mental health holds?
A. They are automatically reported to the National Instant Criminal Background Check System (NICS).
B. They are not reported to the NICS.
C. They are only reported to the NICS if a person is adjudicated as a "mental defective" by a court or other authority.
D. There is no law in Nevada regarding emergency mental health holds.
Correct Answer: B. They are not reported to the NICS.

A. They are prohibited from buying guns.
B. They are allowed to buy guns.
C. They are allowed to buy guns but only after a year-long ERPO has been issued.
D. There is no federal law regarding people who are adjudicated as "mental defectives".
Correct Answer: A. They are prohibited from buying guns.

D. Trump Task Force
Correct Answer: B. Los Angeles 2028 Task Force

B. To oversee the global sporting spectacle
C. To coordinate across federal, state and local agencies
D. To ensure streamlined visa processes, robust security and efficient transportation
Correct Answer: A. To plan the logistics of the 2028 Summer Olympic Games in Los Angeles

Q1. What was the Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) decision on monetary policy after its last meeting in June?
A. The RBI delivered an outsized cut of 50 basis points and switched its stance to "accommodative."
B. The RBI delivered an outsized cut of 50 basis points and switched its stance to "neutral."
C. The RBI delivered a 25 basis point cut and switched its stance to "accommodative."
D. The RBI delivered a 25 basis point cut and switched its stance to "neutral."
Correct Answer: B. The RBI delivered an outsized cut of 50 basis points and switched its stance to "neutral."

Q2. What was the reason for the RBI's decision to switch its stance to "neutral" from "accommodative"?
A. The RBI had limited room for monetary policy to support growth due to the 50-basis-point cut in June.
B. The RBI had limited room for monetary policy to support growth due to the 25-basis-point cut in June.
C. The RBI had limited room for monetary policy to support growth due to the 10-basis-point cut in June.
D. The RBI had limited room for monetary policy to support growth due to the 5-basis-point cut in June.
Correct Answer: A. The RBI had limited room for monetary policy to support growth due to the 50-basis-point cut in June.

A. 6.5%
B. 7.5%

D. 4.5%
Correct Answer: A. 6.5%

Q1. What was the ruling of the U.K.'s Court of Appeal in October last year?
A. It was unlawful for car dealers to receive bonuses from banks providing motor finance without getting the customer's informed consent.
B. It was legal for car dealers to receive bonuses from banks providing motor finance without getting the customer's informed consent.
C. It was legal for car dealers to receive bonuses from banks providing motor finance with the customer's informed consent.
D. It was unclear whether it was legal for car dealers to receive bonuses from banks providing motor finance with the customer's informed consent.
Correct Answer: A

Q2. What did Benjamin Toms, equity analyst at RBC Capital Markets, say in a research note published Monday?
A. He expected the Court of Appeal to find that the banks were liable under statute, focussing on egregious discretionary commissions, but would clear them of liability in equity and under tort.
B. He expected the Court of Appeal to find that the banks were liable under statute, focussing on egregious discretionary commissions, and would hold them liable in equity and under tort.
C. He expected the Court of Appeal to find that the banks were not liable under statute, focussing on egregious discretionary commissions, and would hold them liable in equity and under tort.
D. He expected the Court of Appeal to find that the banks were not liable under statute, focussing on egregious discretionary commissions, and would clear them of liability in equity and under tort.
Correct Answer: A

A. It would set out some of the key decisions it would make around the potential implementation of a redress scheme that would be highly complex in seeking to balance fairness for consumers and the integrity of the motor finance market.
B. It would set out some of the key decisions it would make around the potential implementation of a redress scheme that would be highly complex in seeking to balance fairness for consumers and the integrity of the motor finance market, but would hold

Link: https://www.cnbc.com/2025/07/31/trump-drug-prices-eli-lilly.html
Info: News Article from 
================================================================================
Q1. Which of the following is a fact about the "most favored nation" policy?
A. It aims to slash drug costs by tying the prices of some medicines in the U.S. prescription drug prices, which are two to three times higher on average than those in other developed nations.
B. It promises more of the same: shifting blame and requesting policy changes that would result in billions of dollars in handouts to the industry.
C. It only accepts commitments from drugmakers that provide "American families immediate relief from the vastly inflated drug prices and an end to the free ride of American innovation by European and other developed nations."
D. It is a plan to import foreign price controls, which would undermine American leadership, hurting patients and workers.
Correct Answer: C.

Q2. Which of the following is a fact about the "most favored nation" policy?
A. It asks drugmakers to provide their full portfolio of existing medicines at the lowest price offered in other developed nations – or what he calls the most-favored-nation price – to every single Medicaid patient.
B. It asks drugmakers to adopt models that sell their medicines directly to consumers or businesses, which effectively eliminates middlemen and aims to ensure that all Americans get the same most-favored nation prices that companies offer to third-party payers.
C. It is a plan to import foreign price controls, which would undermine American leadership, hurting patients and workers.
D. It is a plan to reduce price differences with other countries, by rein in health care middlemen driving up costs for Americans and get foreign countries to pay their fair share for innovative medicines.
Correct Answer: B.

Q3. Which of the following is a fact about the "most favored nation" policy?
A. It is a plan to reduce price differences with other countries, by rein in health care middlemen driving up costs for Americans and get foreign countries to pay their fair share for innovative medicines.
B. It is a plan to import foreign price controls, which would undermine American leadership, hurting patients and workers.
C. It is a plan to eliminate middlemen and aims to ensure that all Americans get the same most-favored nation prices that companies offer to third-party payers.

D. Approval of Trulicity for weight loss purposes and insurance coverage for patients.

Q2. What was the main reason for the decline in the first quarter's GDP growth?

B. Huge drop in imports
C. Tariff concerns
D. All of the above
Correct Answer: D

Q3. What was the final sales to private domestic purchasers in the second quarter of 2022?
A. 1.2%
B. 1.9%
C. 2.3%
D. 0.5%
Correct Answer: A

C. The economy added an average of about 35,000 jobs over three months ending in July, which marks a major acceleration from roughly 128,000 jobs added monthly over the prior three months.
D. The economy added an average of about 128,000 jobs over three months ending in July, which marks a major acceleration from roughly 35,000 jobs added monthly over the prior three months.
Correct Answer: A

Q2. What is the current state of the economy according to the jobs report released on Friday?
A. The economy added an average of about 35,000 jobs over three months ending in July, which marks a major slowdown from roughly 128,000 jobs added monthly over the prior three months.
B. The economy added an average of about 128,000 jobs over three months ending in July, which marks a major slowdown from roughly 35,000 jobs added monthly over the prior three months.
C. The economy added an average of about 35,000 jobs over three months ending in July, which marks a major acceleration from roughly 128,000 jobs added monthly over the prior three months.
D. The economy added an average of about 128,000 jobs over three months ending in July, which marks a major acceleration from roughly 35,000 jobs added monthly over the prior three months.
Correct Answer: A

Q3. What is the current state of the economy according to the jobs report released on Friday?
A. The economy added an average of about 35,000 jobs over three months ending in

D. It reduces the quality of goods produced in the U.S.
Correct Answer: B. It lowers prices for consumers.

Link: https://www.cnbc.com/2025/08/08/gold-bars-could-be-hit-with-trumps-tariffs-after-cbp-ruling.html
Info: News Article from 
================================================================================
Q1. What is the CBP's ruling on the classification of one-kilogram and 100-ounce gold bars?
A. They should be classified as unwrought non-monetary gold bullion or dore.
B. They should be classified under a customs code that exempts them from reciprocal tariffs.
C. They should be classified under a customs code that imposes reciprocal tariffs.
D. They should be classified under a customs code that is not applicable to gold bars.
Correct Answer: C. They should be classified under a customs code that imposes reciprocal tariffs.

Q2. What is the International Trade Commission's Harmonized Tariff Schedule (HTS) code for one-kilogram and 100-ounce gold bars?
A. 7108.12.10
B. 7108.12.20
C. 7108.12.30
D. 7108.12.40
Correct Answer: A. 7108.12.10

Q3. What is Deutsche Bank's Hsueh's suggestion for gold exporters to skirt around U.S. tariffs?
A. They should adjust their operations to produce gold in a format that fits HTS code 7108.12.10.
B. They should adjust their operations to produce gold in a format that does not fit HTS code 7108.12.10.
C. They should adjust their operations to produce gold in a format that is not subject to U.S. tariffs.
D. They should adjust their operations to produce gold in a format that is subject to U.S. tariffs.
Correct Answer: A. They should adjust their operations to produce gold in a format that fits HTS code 7108.12.10.

B. Stevens
C. Johnson
D. Benadryl
Correct Answer: B. Stevens

Q2. What is the warning issued by the US Food and Drug Administration about the Benadryl Challenge on TikTok?
A. Overdosing on Benadryl can result in “serious heart problems, seizures, coma, or even death.”
B. The Benadryl Challenge is safe and should be encouraged.
C. The Benadryl Challenge is not a real thing.
D. The Benadryl Challenge is a fun and harmless way to pass time.
Correct Answer: A. Overdosing on Benadryl can result in “serious heart problems, seizures, coma, or even death.”

Q3. What is the statement made by Johnson & Johnson about the Benadryl Challenge on TikTok?
A. The Benadryl Challenge is a safe and fun way to pass time.
B. The Benadryl Challenge is dangerous and should be avoided.
C. The Benadryl Challenge is not a real thing.
D. The Benadryl Challenge is a harmless prank.
Correct Answer: B. The Benadryl Challenge is dangerous and should be avoided.

C. They could promote specific AI rules.
D. They could lead to a revolution in technology.

B. Limited authority.
C. No authority.
D. Unclear authority.

B. Promote specific AI rules.
C. Abide by the law.
D. Mislead consumers about the capabilities and limitations of AI tools.

B. 1%
C. 2%
D. 4%
Correct Answer: D

Q2. What is the reason for the Bank of England to cut the main interest rate?
A. To boost consumer and business confidence
B. To reach the 2% target for consumer prices
C. To reduce unemployment rate
D. To increase taxes
Correct Answer: A

Q3. What is the current unemployment rate in Britain?
A. 3.6%
B. 4.7%
C. 5.3%
D. 6.1%
Correct Answer: B

B. Praise
C. Indifference
D. No comment
